snippet: The Bamako government still controls the southern rump of Malian territory, while the north is in the hands of radical jihadi factions that took over last spring.
abstract: Radical Islamists who control northern Mali appear incapable of managing basic services, including electricity, water and schools, and in some cases are asking for the return of state functionaries to run them; about 400,000 people have fled after the Islamist takeover to the south, where the Bamako government is still in control.
lead_paragraph: The Bamako government still controls the southern rump of Malian territory, while the north is in the hands of radical jihadi factions that took over last spring.

headline.seo: Islamists Struggle to Run North Mali
headline.main: Islamists Struggle to Run North Mali
headline.print_headline: Islamists Struggle to Run North Mali
